moduleDescription: This course investigates the relationship between the internet and international politics, focusing in particular on the role of the internet in security strategy, military strategy, deterrence, coercion, and soft-power projection. On successful completion of the course, students should be able to: (1) deepen their understanding and capacity to engage in social scientific inquiry through the lens of internet studies (2) take stock of the world they live in and how it is similar and different from previous eras (3) expand their content knowledge possibly contributing new Capstone ideas or thoughts for future graduate study/employment opportunities.
